ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great course. Professor Curry is one of the best instructors I've had at Yale. Brilliant and well-prepared for every class. Great at tying concepts together and linking the micro back to the macro, including a great balance of her own expertise/stories/experience and soliciting input from the class. Terrific syllabus and guest speakers.
Strength- Prof. Curry and also guest faculty who teach the courseWeakness- Can be structured better
Excellent foundation in the role of evidence in global health and how to prepare a research proposal and presentation. Great class discussions.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  One of the best at YSPH
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Helpful input into student presentations, excellent presentation on mental health in Ghana
Instructor: Leslie Curry  Wonderful person, friendly, approachable, great teacher
Instructor: Leslie Curry  Wonderful teacher. Insightful, personable, thoughtful. Thank you!
Instructor: Michael Skonieczny  Did not interact with him much in this course. Just came for one session

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Alexandra Marion Adams  one of most hardworking TAs at YSPH
Instructor: Mary Weng  Very helpful and kind and generous with her time. Committed to being a good TA, and it showed and was appreciated!
Instructor: Mary Weng  Both TAs put a lot of work into this course and were a valuable resource for students.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Terrific course if you're at all interested in issues related to global health and implementation--or policy.
Highly recommend it if interested in research

This course provides valuable insight into important issues in research with a particular emphasis on it's role in global health and how translate evidence into policy. I would highly recommend this course for anyone who wants to make an impact in health outcomes in global health.
